event.title: is believed that the area that is now

data.event: It is believed that the area that is now Alexandria was first settled by Frank Spilman and his family c. 1793.

event.title: settled by Frank Spilman and his family c. 1793

data.event: It is believed that the area that is now Alexandria was first settled by Frank Spilman and his family c. 1793.

event.title: 1819, the year the first post office was established

data.event: The family had begun developing and selling lots in the settlement by 1819, the year the first post office was established.
On February 22, 1834, Alexandria was formally established by an act of the state assembly.

event.title: formed Kenton County from part of Campbell County in 1840

data.event: When the Kentucky General Assembly formed Kenton County from part of Campbell County in 1840, they moved Campbell's county seat from Newport to Alexandria, which was closer to the center of the redrawn county.
